title: Calories in a Large Baked Potato
meta_description: Discover calories in large baked potato, including full nutrition breakdown per serving, macros, and easy tweaks for toppings.
h1: Calories in a Large Baked Potato
assumptions: Large russet potato (~299 g with skin), baked plain without oil, salt, or toppings; skin on.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by potato variety, size, baking method, and added ingredients. Check labels or sources for precision.

quick_answer.text: A large baked potato offers ~278 kcal and ~7.5 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in a large baked potato with skin?
faqs.a: Approximately 278 kcal for one large (~299 g) plain baked potato.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a large baked potato?
faqs.a: About 63 g total carbs, including 7.5 g fiber.

faqs.q: Is a baked potato low in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, only 0.4 g fat per large potato, mostly unsaturated.

faqs.q: How does baking affect potato calories?
faqs.a: Baking retains most nutrients with minimal added calories compared to frying.

faqs.q: Calories in a medium vs. large baked potato?
faqs.a: Medium (~173 g) has ~161 kcal; large is about 73% more.
